intro: Piaranthus, commonly known as the desert bell, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Acanthaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to southern Africa. These plants are characterized by their showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. They are typically found in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Piaranthus species are often cultivated for their ornamental value due to their striking blooms and drought tolerance.
